abstract: Neuroscientists at Japan's Riken Brain Science Institute devise chemical cocktail that turns the dead brain tissue into a glassy, see-through substance, allowing clearer view of material that lies inside. Discovery is published in journal Nature Neuroscience.
snippet: Japanese neuroscientists have devised a way to turn the brain’s opaque gray matter into a glassy, see-through substance.
lead_paragraph: Japanese neuroscientists have devised a way to turn the brain’s opaque gray matter into a glassy, see-through substance.

headline.main: New Way to Gain a Clear View of the Brain
